source.name: City of Miami Department of Solid Waste
source.notes: Based on official City of Miami recycling do's and don'ts guidelines. Paper cups (hot and cold) are accepted. Lithium batteries explicitly flagged as fire hazard.

materials.name: Plastic bottles
notes: No foam/styrofoam containers
Miami accepts most rigid plastic bottles and containers
commonMistakes: Don't include bottles with liquid still in them
Don't include foam or styrofoam bottles
Don't leave lids or straws on

materials.name: Plastic containers
notes: Rigid plastic containers only — no foam
No styrofoam
commonMistakes: Don't include styrofoam or foam containers
Don't include containers with food residue

materials.name: PP plastic cups
notes: Miami specifically accepts PP (polypropylene / #5) plastic cups
commonMistakes: Don't include foam cups
Don't include lids or straws — those go in trash

materials.name: Paper cups (hot beverages)
instructions: Remove lid and straw/stirrer — those go in trash
Place cup in blue recycling bin
notes: Miami accepts paper cups for both hot and cold beverages — this is unusual compared to most cities
Lids, straws, and stirrers are NOT accepted
commonMistakes: Don't forget to remove the lid
Don't include stirrers or straws
Don't include foam cups

materials.name: Paper cups (cold beverages)
instructions: Remove lid and straw — those go in trash
Place cup in blue recycling bin
notes: Miami accepts paper cups for cold beverages
Lids and straws must be removed and trashed
commonMistakes: Don't include the lid or straw
Don't include foam cups

materials.name: Aluminum cans
notes: All aluminum beverage cans accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include cans with liquid still in them

materials.name: Glass bottles
notes: Food and beverage glass bottles accepted
No window glass, auto glass, mirrors, or light bulbs
commonMistakes: Don't include window or auto glass
Don't include mirrors or light bulbs
Don't include broken glass — wrap and trash

materials.name: Glass jars
notes: Food-grade glass jars accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include ceramics or pottery
Don't include Pyrex or tempered glass

materials.name: Corrugated cardboard
notes: Corrugated cardboard is accepted in blue bin
commonMistakes: Don't include cardboard soaked with grease
Don't leave packing materials inside

materials.name: Newspapers
notes: All newspapers accepted
commonMistakes: Don't bag in plastic bags

materials.name: Magazines and catalogs
notes: Glossy paper and staples are fine
commonMistakes: Don't remove staples

materials.name: Mixed paper
notes: All clean mixed paper accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include paper towels or tissues
Don't include food-soiled paper

materials.name: Paperboard / thin cardboard
notes: Thin cardboard boxes are part of mixed paper/boxes category
commonMistakes: Don't include if heavily soiled with food
Remove plastic liners

materials.name: Beverage cartons
notes: Miami accepts beverage cartons (milk, juice, broth, etc.)
commonMistakes: Don't include cartons with liquid still in them

materials.name: Books
instructions: Otherwise place in blue recycling bin
notes: Donating is preferred over recycling
commonMistakes: Don't throw usable books in trash

materials.name: Aerosol cans (empty)
notes: Non-empty aerosols are hazardous waste
commonMistakes: Don't recycle if still pressurized
Don't puncture

materials.name: Aluminum foil (clean)
instructions: Ball up into a fist-sized ball
notes: Must be clean; heavily soiled foil goes in trash
commonMistakes: Don't recycle foil with baked-on food

materials.name: Aluminum trays
notes: Aluminum is infinitely recyclable
commonMistakes: Don't include heavily soiled trays

materials.name: Steel / tin cans
notes: A magnet will stick to steel cans but not aluminum
commonMistakes: Don't include cans with food still in them

materials.name: Plastic bags
instructions: Do NOT place in blue recycling bin
Take clean dry bags to grocery store drop-off bins
notes: Plastic bags jam recycling machinery
Miami explicitly lists plastic bags as not accepted in recycling
commonMistakes: Never bag recyclables in plastic bags
Don't put any film plastic in the blue bin

materials.name: Styrofoam / polystyrene
notes: Miami explicitly prohibits styrofoam in blue bin recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put styrofoam in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Food waste / household garbage
instructions: Miami does not have a curbside composting program
notes: Household garbage and food are not accepted in the blue recycling bin
No curbside composting; consider home composting
commonMistakes: Don't put food waste in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Meat and bones
instructions: Bag and place in regular trash
notes: No curbside composting in Miami
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Coffee grounds / tea bags
notes: No curbside composting in Miami; consider home composting
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Dairy products
instructions: The food itself goes in regular trash
Rinse and recycle the container in the blue bin
notes: Separate container from contents
commonMistakes: Don't recycle containers with food still in them

materials.name: Electronics / E-waste
instructions: Do NOT place in blue recycling bin or regular trash
Take to a Miami-Dade County Household Hazardous Waste facility
notes: Miami explicitly prohibits e-waste in recycling
Delete personal data before disposal
commonMistakes: Don't put electronics in the blue bin or trash
Don't forget to wipe personal data

materials.name: Batteries
instructions: Do NOT place in blue recycling bin or regular trash
Lithium batteries are an explicit fire hazard
Tape terminals of lithium and 9V batteries
Take to Miami-Dade County Household Hazardous Waste facility
notes: Miami specifically flags lithium batteries as a fire hazard in recycling and trash
All batteries should be disposed at hazardous waste collection
commonMistakes: Never put batteries in the blue recycling bin — fire risk
Don't throw in regular trash — especially lithium batteries

materials.name: Paint
instructions: Do NOT place in blue recycling bin or regular trash
Take to Miami-Dade Household Hazardous Waste facility
notes: Miami explicitly lists paint as not accepted in recycling
commonMistakes: Don't pour paint down the drain
Don't put liquid paint in the trash

materials.name: Pesticides and chemicals
instructions: Do NOT place in blue recycling bin or regular trash
Take to Miami-Dade Household Hazardous Waste facility
notes: Miami explicitly lists pesticides and chemicals as prohibited from recycling
commonMistakes: Don't pour down drains
Don't put in regular trash

materials.name: Medical waste / pharmaceuticals
instructions: Do NOT place in blue recycling bin or regular trash
Take medications to a pharmacy drug take-back program
Sharps: place in puncture-proof container, label 'SHARPS'
notes: Miami explicitly prohibits medical waste and pharmaceuticals in recycling
commonMistakes: Never flush medications
Don't put loose sharps in any bin

materials.name: Window glass / auto glass
instructions: Wrap carefully in newspaper or cardboard
Do NOT put in blue recycling bin
notes: Window glass and auto glass have different composition than bottle glass and cannot be recycled together
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling bin with regular glass

materials.name: Light bulbs
instructions: CFL/fluorescent: take to hazardous waste facility (contains mercury)
LED/incandescent: wrap and place in regular trash
Do NOT put any bulbs in the blue recycling bin
notes: Miami explicitly lists light bulbs as not accepted in recycling
CFL bulbs contain mercury and are hazardous
commonMistakes: Don't put light bulbs in the blue recycling bin
Handle CFL bulbs carefully — they contain mercury

materials.name: Mirrors
instructions: Do NOT put in blue recycling bin
notes: Miami explicitly prohibits mirrors in recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Clothing / textiles
instructions: Donate to Goodwill, Salvation Army, or local charities
Clothing and carpet are NOT accepted in blue recycling bin
Worn-out textiles still accepted at textile donation bins
notes: Miami explicitly lists clothing, furniture, and carpets as not accepted in recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put clothing in the blue recycling bin or regular trash

materials.name: Furniture
instructions: Schedule bulk pickup through 311 or miamigov.com
Do NOT place in blue recycling bin
notes: Miami lists furniture as not accepted in recycling
Call 311 for bulk pickup scheduling
commonMistakes: Don't put furniture in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Construction debris
instructions: Not accepted in blue recycling bin or regular trash
Must be taken to a construction and demolition debris facility
notes: Miami explicitly prohibits construction debris in recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue bin or regular trash

materials.name: Yard waste
instructions: Place in yard waste bags or bundle branches
Set out separately from regular trash for collection
Do NOT place in blue recycling bin
notes: Miami has separate yard waste collection — check miamigov.com for schedule
Not accepted in blue recycling bin
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Pizza box (clean)
instructions: If clean or minimal grease, place in blue recycling bin
Tear off clean lid for recycling; trash greasy bottom
notes: Clean cardboard is recyclable in Miami
commonMistakes: Don't recycle heavily greased pizza boxes

materials.name: Pizza box (greasy)
instructions: Greasy pizza boxes go in regular trash
Tear off clean portions for recycling if possible
notes: Grease contaminates paper recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put greasy pizza boxes in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Straws and stirrers
instructions: Remove from cups before recycling cups
notes: Miami requires removal of lids, straws, and stirrers before recycling cups
commonMistakes: Don't leave straws in recyclable cups

materials.name: Lids and caps
instructions: Place lids and caps in regular trash
notes: Miami requires removal of all lids before recycling containers
commonMistakes: Don't leave lids on recyclable containers

materials.name: Candy wrapper
notes: Multi-layer film packaging cannot be recycled
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Chip bag / snack bag
notes: Metallized plastic cannot be separated for recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Diapers
instructions: Bag and place in regular trash
notes: Not recyclable or compostable
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Receipts
instructions: Thermal paper contains BPA — cannot be recycled
notes: Thermal receipts contaminate paper recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Pet waste
instructions: Bag and place in regular trash
notes: Contains harmful bacteria
commonMistakes: Don't flush cat litter

materials.name: Bubble wrap / packing materials
instructions: Or drop off plastic film at grocery store collection bins
notes: Plastic film jams recycling machinery
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Wax paper / parchment paper
notes: Wax/silicone coating prevents recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Ceramics / pottery
notes: Ceramics contaminate glass recycling
commonMistakes: Don't mix with glass recyclables

materials.name: Propane tanks
instructions: Take to Miami-Dade Household Hazardous Waste facility
Never put in regular trash or blue recycling bin
notes: Pressurized containers are fire and explosion risks
commonMistakes: Never puncture
Never put in trash or recycling

materials.name: Cooking oil / grease
instructions: Place sealed container in regular trash
Small amounts can be absorbed with paper towels and trashed
notes: Never pour oil down the drain
commonMistakes: Don't pour down sink or storm drains

materials.name: Hangers
notes: Wire hangers jam recycling machinery
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Plastic utensils
notes: Too small for recycling machinery
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Wrapping paper
instructions: Plain uncoated paper wrapping: blue recycling bin
notes: Most wrapping paper has coatings that prevent recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put metallic or glittery wrapping paper in recycling

materials.name: Toothbrush
notes: Mixed plastic materials; not recyclable curbside
commonMistakes: Don't put in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Smartphone / cell phone
instructions: Factory reset and wipe personal data
Take to Miami-Dade Household Hazardous Waste facility or Best Buy
notes: Phones contain valuable recoverable materials
Battery fire risk in trash
commonMistakes: Don't forget to wipe personal data
Don't put in regular trash

materials.name: Motor oil
instructions: Take to auto parts store or Miami-Dade Household Hazardous Waste facility
notes: Most auto parts stores accept oil for free
commonMistakes: Don't pour down drains or into storm sewers

materials.name: Mattress
instructions: Or take to a disposal facility
notes: Not accepted in blue recycling bin or regular trash
commonMistakes: Don't leave at curb without scheduling

materials.name: Appliances
instructions: Remove doors from refrigerators for safety
notes: Contains recyclable metals but cannot go curbside
commonMistakes: Don't put in regular trash

materials.name: Tires
instructions: Take to a tire retailer or disposal facility
notes: Tires cannot go in regular trash
commonMistakes: Don't dump illegally
Don't put in any curbside bin

materials.name: Fast food wrapper
instructions: Clean paper wrappers: blue recycling bin if uncoated
notes: Grease contaminates paper recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put greasy wrappers in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Makeup / cosmetics containers
instructions: Clean rigid plastic containers may go in blue bin
notes: Small items fall through sorting screens
commonMistakes: Don't put nail polish in regular trash

materials.name: Ink / toner cartridges
instructions: Return to Staples or Office Depot
notes: Some stores give credit for returns
commonMistakes: Don't throw in regular trash

materials.name: Shredded paper
notes: Shredded paper slips through recycling screens
commonMistakes: Don't put loose shredded paper in the blue bin

materials.name: Chargers and cables
instructions: Take to Best Buy or e-waste collection event
Do NOT put in blue recycling bin
notes: Cables tangle in recycling machinery
commonMistakes: Don't put cables or cords in the blue recycling bin

recycle: Paper cups — both hot and cold (remove lids/straws/stirrers)
Window glass, auto glass, light bulbs, and mirrors

tips: Miami uses BLUE bins for recycling
Empty all liquids from containers before recycling
Remove ALL lids, straws, and stirrers before placing items in the blue bin
Paper cups (both hot and cold) ARE accepted — unusual for most cities
Lithium batteries are a specific fire hazard — never put in recycling or trash
No curbside composting program — food waste goes in regular trash
Plastic bags, styrofoam, and foam are never accepted in recycling
Contact 311 or visit miamigov.com for collection schedules and bulk pickup
Take hazardous waste to Miami-Dade County Household Hazardous Waste facilities
When in doubt, check miami.gov recycling do's and don'ts
